data.title: Large portions of fresh food
data.text: We stopped here on the way from Burbank airport to Santa Barbara. Great Italian food but the portions were enormous. We could easily have shared a plate. The olive spread on the bread is filling and delicious.  I could eat this a few times a week.  Great service.

data.title: Our Date Night Go-To
data.text: My husband and I love to come here for our date nights.  The service is always great.  We feel like we are part of the family here.  They have a great wine selection and amazing italian food.  We are never let down.

data.title: Cute in Old Town
data.text: Cute place. Nice atmosphere. Food is good, not great but overall good. Parking can be tricky and a pain but overall a cute place.

data.title: Ambiance and Great Food
data.text: It was a rainy night and the Italian Restaurant where we originally planned to eat was too crowded with NO parking places so we decided to head down the road to Verona Trattoria. We were worried when the hostess asked if we had reservations and then left us to check on a computer in the back, but she came back and seated us at a cozy table in the front. It seemed like forever before someone finally came and took our drink order. Once again, I think we were forgotten about and it took forever to order and get our food, but it was really delicious and I think we will be back.

data.title: Not for the picky eater
data.text: Good food and atmosphere, but don't bring anyone who is a picky eater. Limited number of dinner entrée choices.

data.title: S-L-O-W service
data.text: The food was good. I had chicken Gorgonzola. Service was very slow. We were a group of 10 and the only people in restaurant.  we waited a long time for server to take orders and even longer time for food to arrive.  server would disappear for periods of time . We wondered if he was also the chef.  We requested more bread which arrived much later. It took what seemed liked forever for server to collect our payment. As much as I enjoyed the food, I would not return based on slow service.  I rarely write a negative review but feel that I had to write this one as negative .

data.title: Like a visit to Nonni's house....that good!
data.text:
When my client suggested this place, I was surprised by the homey atmosphere; not dumpy, but like visiting a nice house.   The room was decorated warmly for Christmas, with fun retro music.   And the smell---the minute I walked in, I could tell I was in for a treat.
A very nice menu, with lots of old favorites, but not in that super heavy old italian lounge way.  A salad to start with gorgonzola and pear was presented very attractively with finely shaved pears around the edge of the plate.   We both had pasta, and it was excellent.   Gnocchi was light and rich.  Just right.   Had marinara on server's recommendation, and it was spicy, thick and fresh tasting.

Service was impeccable.   There when we needed it, in the background when not.   Do not miss the classic Bananas Foster for dessert.   Made tableside on a cart with a good balance of caramel and rum....hot and goey and delicious.

The flavors reminded me of eating at my Italian grandmother's house.  You can taste the love.    Really a memorable meal.

data.title: I'm glad I tried Verona Trattoria again!
data.text: I reviewed this restaurant a few years ago and concluded that I wouldn't be back. Since then I did return with friends. I didn't want to eat here, but I didn't want to complicate our evening. I was completely surprised by the wonderful meal I ate. I decided not to review this restaurant again until I had a couple good experiences and I sure did. I've been back several times. I've been seated both inside and outside. The atmosphere is intimate and relaxing. I always prefer to eat outside. The service has also been very good. But good service and nice atmosphere don't matter at all if the food isn't good, and the food here has been excellent! I'm not sure what happened a few years ago when I visited and had a bad experience, but I am now happy to call this restaurant one of my favorites!

data.title: Dreamy Food
data.text:
My husband and I tried this restaurant tonight. The food was delicious! We shared the baby artichoke appetizer, Carciofo, wow! Delicious. Also shared the rigatoni in creamy vodka sauce. Very good sauces.
Wait staff was pleasant but professional. Good service.
Atmosphere is nice.
Drawbacks in my opinion were that they were playing noisy, unidentifiable  rock music. Better would be Italian instrumental music or classical played sotto voce.
Also, walls are in need of some patch and paint.
Highly recommend this restaurant for excellent food and service.

data.title: Great Food, Great Service.
data.text: I pass this place on my way home from work each day and it always smells amazing. We arrived later in the evening so there were few others in the restaurant and it was quiet. We ordered seafood/pasta specials and both were fantastic. The Créme Brulée was torched table-side and was also excellent. Both of our servers were pleasant and attentive, and offered to customize our dishes though we declined. A little pricey but it was worth it!

data.title: Rude Waiter and  SMALL portions!
data.text: My husband and I went to this "place" on our anniversary WITH A RESERVATION MIND YOU, UNBEKNOWNST to US, it was a totally classless place. We didn't even finish our lousy dinner or bottle of wine we order, which was WAY over priced for the inexpensive bottle served, WE WERE ASKED to leave because people were waiting for a table, REALLY, WHO DOES THAT? WE THE CUSTOMER HAD A RESERVATION!  Why overbook your small less the proper "place." The waiter was SO UNrefined it was unreal. We thought we were on Candid Camera, NO REALLY WE DID. That is how shocked we were with this type of behavior. WE HAVE NEVER BEEN BACK NOR WILL WE EVER GO BACK. Waste of MONEY TIME AND ENERGY. MOST UNROMANTIC "place" Gentlemen DO NOT take your girlfriend/spouse here, its not romantic at all!!!!!!!!!!!!! Sure glad I found this tripadvisor spot where we could post OUR HONEST comment. Lousy service and extremely RUDE waiter. WORSE SO CALLED ITALIAN FOOD IN CAMARILLO, TRY Ottavios you will NOT be disappointed. Plus this small unrefined "place" doesn't have a parking lot, well that suits it as this place couldn't handle a crowd!  Not worth the 1 Star posted, but have to post at least ONE, ugh! I say RUN past this "place" you'll be glad you did!

data.title: Great atmosphere and very above average Italian food for So. Cal. but way too pricey.
data.text: I think I summed it up in the title. The food is good and the atmosphere is excellent...it's just way over-priced. We drive a little further for better quality food that is priced better too.

data.title: Wonderful Italian Food
data.text: This family-run restaurant always serves great, fresh food. Scallops are hot, done perfectly, and fresh. Chicken Marsala has a great sauce. Pasta is always al dente. Waiters are knowledgeable and friendly. We go here for special occasions. Generally it's quiet on the week nights and busy weekends. Charming atmosphere reminds me of actual restaurants in Italy.

data.title: Hidden Gem! Creative and Divine Cuisine!
data.text:
Verona Trattoria in Camarillo is a Hidden Gem! Dishes are prepared with the freshest ingredients, locally sourced, and designed to both nourish and delight. On a weekday it is a romantic candlelit bistro. On Friday or Saturday it is a bustling café (dining inside or al fresco) with families and friends filling the place. World class, divine cuisine by Chef Julio Perez and wonderful service by the entire staff. Consistently magnificent experience. Thank you!

Our family's favorites so far…

Fresh jumbo Morro Bay scallops pan seared topped with citrus garlic reduction served over angel hair pasta. Incredible!

Fresh clam chowder better than have enjoyed anywhere---San Francisco, Seattle, Boston.

Calamari Fritti, lightly fried calamari rings served with marinara sauce

Seared Ahi Tuna Salad, flavorful and perfect combination of ingredients

Filet Barolo. Beef tenderloin grilled with red wine, shallot, reduction.

Desserts of Cannoli, Tiramisu, or Crepes 

Wine choices offered perfectly compliment the gourmet meals. 

Reservations accepted and recommended for Friday or Saturday.

data.title: Consistent & good
data.text:
This is a really nice family run operation.  We've been coming here for years.  It's a great place to go when we can't decide where else to go.  The food is always good and the service very friendly.
If you're new here, I would highly recommend the specials - almost always excellent.
On the regular menu - my wife's favorite is the pasta arbiatta, simply one of the best you'll find anywhere; if you like tomatoes, it'll be nirvana.  My favorite is the scallops - fabulous flavor.

data.title: Good food...not much ambience
data.text: We've eaten here several times (usually for lunch) and enjoy the food. Service is excellent. I find the ambience lacking... a bit bare and too quiet. There is just something lacking in the over-all experience. The owners need to create a cozier (for lack of a better word) space. Soft Italian music playing would help. Not a good date destination because  of the lack of atmosphere.

data.title: What a nice surprise in Camarillo's Old Town!
data.text:
We've seen this place for quite a while, as it's next to the Southbound 101 Freeway onramp from Ventura Boulevard...but we never ventured in before--a mistake!

We had the temerity to make a reservation for Mother's Day, and braced for the typical bad holiday experience...but were surprised to find everyone cheerful, the food wonderful, and the place half empty.  What's going on here, Camarillo?!  

Lunch is more of a dinner, so that may be part of the half empty, but the selection was very interesting, and the food well prepared.  I had Morro Bay scallops, which is a real test of the kitchen.  They arrived piping hot, and neither over or under cooked.  Bravo!  The veal and chicken marsalas were reportedly delicious, and eggplant parmesan was fresh and tasty.

Wine selection was limited but excellent.  Prices reasonable for the quality of food.

Atmosphere is a bit plain...floors are concrete, walls painted, not a stitch of sound absorbing material in the place, so it can be noisy even with half the tables empty!

We'll be back.

data.title: Not Special
data.text: We looked forward to our visit. The restaurant looked great from the outside. We couldn't get a table outside, but were happy inside until we got our food. It was plain and tasteless. It tasted like it came out of a can and didn't look much better. There is not much more I can say. We went with friends and not one of us was happy with our meal and without good food, what's left? Service was average, but even great service can't make up for a disappointing meal. We won't be back.

data.title: Lovely ambience, food was very good, excellent service, and the serving sizes were just right.
data.text: My son-in-law & family love this place & invited us out for a New Year's Eve dinner. It was a lovely evening. The wait staff was very efficient & professional, and we all loved our entrees. I ordered their special which was lobster stuffed filet & it was cooked perfectly & the presentation was delightful. There was a nice serving of fresh sautéed veggies alongside the entree. So that with the toasted bread & dipping sauce, plus their delicious house salad was perfect. My husband had the pasta Alfredo, one of my granddaughters had pasta & homemade meatballs which she loved. Everything is made in house. My husband also had the clam chowder in a homemade sourdough bread bowl & he raved about that too. Creme brûlée was carmelized right in front of us & it was the best we've ever had (next my daughter's homemade).  Yes, I will definitely return as will my family. It was wonderful being so welcomed in a family owned & run operation. Very warm feeling.

data.title: Camarillo Italian "Fair"
data.text: Took my son to Verona Trattoria during my recent visit to Camarillo. Had a hard time time deciding where to go in Camarillo because there just isn't a whole lot of choices although downtown Camarillo has a few choices. I wish I had decided to go elsewhere. My son and I walked in to the restaurant and it was empty save for a table of four older ladies at almost 6:00pm. We sat where we wanted to and were quickly given menus and our candle was lit. I ordered a glass of wine, my son ordered water and told the waiter we would be a little longer deciding on our entrees. The waiter came back almost ten minutes later to take our orders but neglected to bring our drinks. I had to ask for them to be brought. I ordered the Osso Bucco and my son ordered the chicken piccata. The wine was a good price for the dinner hour, but the entrees, Oy! The time it took to finally get our entrees I thought was way too long. About half an hour. While we were waiting for our food I had a chance to watch the people at the bar. They appeared to be the family of the waitress or owner. One was drinking wine, the waitress was eating and her son was running around the bar area, sometimes in a loud voice! Totally inappropriate! The Osso Bucco was way over salted and did not taste as if it was made fresh that day. The sauce was thick and burned tasting. No pride in the cooking as far as I am concerned. Would not go there again as there just doesn't seem like there is any professionalism in running the place relative to the food or family members present. The waitress even came to the table with the phone cradled on her shoulder talking to someone. My advice is to watch a few episodes of Kitchen Nightmare's with Gordon Ramsey to see why your customers are not coming back. Send your family members home, make your food fresh and make your customers want to return to a restaurant that looks so nice on the outside but does not follow thru on its service or taste.
